sn7.4:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.
sn7.4:4.2: The brahmin Bharadvāja the Bitter heard a rumor to the effect that:
sn7.4:4.3: “A brahmin of the Bharadvāja clan has gone forth from the lay life to homelessness in the presence of the ascetic Gotama!” Angry and displeased he went to the Buddha
sn7.4:4.4: and stood silently to one side.
sn7.4:4.5: Then the Buddha, knowing what Bhāradvāja the Bitter was thinking, addressed him in verse:
sn7.4:5.1: “Whoever wrongs a man who’s done no wrong,
sn7.4:5.2: a pure man with a spotless record,
sn7.4:5.3: the evil backfires back on the fool,
sn7.4:6.1: When he said this, the brahmin Bhāradvāja the Bitter said to the Buddha:
sn7.4:6.4: And Venerable Bhāradvāja became one of the perfected.
